definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: In particular, I'd like to thank Ms.
sentences.chinese: 我特別感謝凱蘭女士大駕光臨。
我們要特別感謝發起人羅君平先生。

sentences.english: He especially thanked the Chinese Academy of Sciences for allowing him to become an academician.
sentences.chinese: 他特別感謝中科院讓他成爲院士。

sentences.english: Thank you guys for answering these questions and for creating a wonderful product!
sentences.chinese: 特別感謝你回答這些問題和創立了這麼棒的教程。

sentences.english: And special thanks for Vampraths and Lueur to help me on the translation.
sentences.chinese: 特別感謝良夜和微光幫我看翻譯。

sentences.english: Special thanks to MSG Entertainment and the Beacon Theatre.
sentences.chinese: 特別感謝MSG娛樂公司以及燈塔劇院。

sentences.english: We are particularly grateful to him for his timely help.
sentences.chinese: 我們特別感謝他的及時幫助。

sentences.english: Here is my special thanks to Mr. Cheung for his kind assistance and advice in the event.
sentences.chinese: 在此特別感謝張姓老街坊在當中提供的寶貴意見。

definition: to make a speech/to make some remarks
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
